2023-06-18T20:05:27Z: With that, we'll call time on this live text coverage of the Canadian GP. Thanks for following along with us and have a lovely rest of your Sundays! Go well!
2023-06-18T20:03:27Z: Red Bull will aim to continue its winning run in 2023 at its home race - as the Austria GP is up next on 30 June-2 July. For added spice, it is a sprint race.
2023-06-18T20:00:11Z:
So that concludes the Canadian GP - another win for Verstappen and another win for Red Bull to keep the team's 100% record in 2023. How long can it last?
    
Max Verstappen, Red Bull Racing RB19, Lewis Hamilton, Mercedes F1 W14, Fernando Alonso, Aston Martin AMR23, George Russell, Mercedes F1 W14, Esteban Ocon, Alpine A523, the rest of the field at the start
Photo by: Andy Hone / Motorsport Images
2023-06-18T19:56:59Z: The Dutch and Austrian national anthems ring out for Verstappen and Red Bull on the podium and here come the Canadian GP trophies and fizzy stuff. All three can be happy with their days for different reasons.
2023-06-18T19:50:53Z:
Here's the report on the Canadian GP:https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-canadian-gp-race-report/10484848/
    
Max Verstappen, Red Bull Racing RB19, Lewis Hamilton, Mercedes F1 W14, Fernando Alonso, Aston Martin AMR23
Photo by: Andy Hone / Motorsport Images
2023-06-18T19:47:49Z: Alonso also confirmed he was managing a brake issue, as required by Aston Martin, towards the end of the race.
2023-06-18T19:43:18Z: Canadian GP results: 1. Verstappen 2. Alonso 3. Hamilton 4. Leclerc 5. Sainz 6. Perez 7. Albon 8. Ocon 9. Stroll 10. Bottas 11. Piastri 12. Gasly 13. Norris 14. Tsunoda 15. Hulkenberg 16. Zhou 17. Magnussen 18. De Vries DNF Russell, Sargeant
2023-06-18T19:39:27Z: Perez is sixth and also bags the fastest lap bonus point thanks to his late pitstop to switch to soft tyres.
2023-06-18T19:38:58Z: With his penalty, Norris drops to P13, promoting Stroll to P9 and Bottas into the final points-paying position.
2023-06-18T19:38:28Z: In the battle for the minor points positions, Albon fends off Ocon and Norris.
2023-06-18T19:38:13Z: Alonso keeps clear of Hamilton for second place - as the Ferraris come home safely with Leclerc fourth and Sainz fifth.
2023-06-18T19:37:21Z: Max Verstappen wins the Canadian Grand Prix! That's Red Bull's 100th F1 victory!
2023-06-18T19:35:51Z: Into the final two laps and the fight for the top spots looks settled, as Perez pits from sixth place - hunting for the fastest lap?
2023-06-18T19:35:08Z: Norris attempts to outbrake Ocon into the hairpin but thinks better of it. With DRS, he is unable to make the move into Turn 1.
2023-06-18T19:33:22Z: Alonso has rebuffed Hamilton's advances as the gap between the two grows to 3.1s.
2023-06-18T19:32:53Z: Norris has now caught Albon and Ocon, as Stroll locks up and runs wide at the hairpin. He has work to do to catch back up to Bottas.
2023-06-18T19:31:09Z: Norris' move has split this pack somewhat, with ALbon and Ocon around one second clear of Norris as the others drop back.
2023-06-18T19:30:04Z: Norris gets bored of waiting for someone to make a move and lunges on Bottas at the hairpin. The battle continues into the final chicane and the McLaren driver is up into ninth. Ocon is up next!
2023-06-18T19:28:40Z: This train behind Albon continues to frustrate. The Williams driver pitted behind the safety car and, unlike many others, has not made a second stop.
2023-06-18T19:26:12Z: Hamilton is told Alonso is looking after a rear brake issue, as he inches towards the Aston Martin. The gap is at 1.8s.
2023-06-18T19:23:54Z: Stroll has now joined the train too. Norris needs a five-second margin on the Aston Martin driver to negate his penalty.
2023-06-18T19:22:41Z: Since their pitstops, both Ferrari drivers have eased clear of Perez, so fourth and fifth looks secure for the Italian squad as we enter the final 10 laps of the race.
2023-06-18T19:22:07Z: Albon now has Ocon for immediate company, with Bottas and Norris in a train behind. But bad news for those following, Albon has just set his personal-best time.
2023-06-18T19:20:35Z: Hamilton has cut the gap to just under 2s on Alonso, so this one isn't over. Verstappen, meanwhile, is 7.5s clear so the battle for the lead definitely is.
2023-06-18T19:15:33Z: Verstappen is pushing clear now, as the gap is up to 6.3s over Alonso. We've seen how this one usually ends. Alonso's fight will be with Hamilton for second place until the end of the race.
2023-06-18T19:11:29Z: Verstappen, keeping an eye on his tyre life, is managing his lead at 5.5s over Alonso, while the Aston Martin driver is being told to lift and coast.
2023-06-18T19:09:20Z: Alonso has a slow lap, running off track at Turn 8, and that's allowed Hamilton to take 2s out of his deficit to the Spaniard.
2023-06-18T19:07:15Z: The leading trio are setting near-identical lap times in the 1m16.0s bracket, but the gaps are stretched out so we don't have any on-track battles just yet.
2023-06-18T19:07:01Z: Aston Martin entered the weekend with Lawrence Stroll setting his drivers the target of a double podium. While Alonso is doing his job, Stroll is outside the points in P12. It's another disappointing drive from the Canadian so far.
2023-06-18T19:02:35Z: Verstappen does dive into the pits - it is a no brainer as it is a free pitstop - and he comes out around 5s clear in the lead.
2023-06-18T19:01:04Z: No further action, is the decision. No penalty for either De Vries or Magnussen.
2023-06-18T19:00:45Z: And, as expected, Alonso pits next time around to cover off Hamilton. Can we have a full Mexican wave of pitstops with Verstappen in the next time around?
2023-06-18T18:59:59Z: Hamilton pits for the second time in the race, taking on fresh mediums, and retains third thanks to the gap created behind him by the pitting Ferraris.
2023-06-18T18:59:16Z: The incident between De Vries and Magnussen is now under investigation. Given De Vries locking up was what took the pair off the track, there is surely only one way any penalty would go.
2023-06-18T18:58:43Z: At the end of lap 39 Leclerc pits, also swapping his mediums for hards like Sainz, and rejoins in fourth ahead of Sainz - just as Perez clears Albon.
2023-06-18T18:57:46Z: Sainz pits to cover off Perez, keeping him in fifth on fresh hards, with Albon splitting him from the Mexican.
2023-06-18T18:56:32Z: Perez pits for the first time in this race, dipping in from sixth, to swap his hards for fresh mediums and comes out in seventh.
2023-06-18T18:55:51Z: While that de Vries vs Magnussen tussle unfolded, the Ferrari mechanics scampered into the pitlane to pre-empt a safety car but nothing doing so Leclerc and Sainz continue to pound around on 38-lap old mediums.
2023-06-18T18:55:40Z: Russell is now P9. Granted, these positions have been gained through the stops of others, but what a job from the Mercedes driver!
2023-06-18T18:54:50Z: Magnussen stops at the end of the lap and fits mediums. That goes against the strategy employed by most so far. The stewards have noted the incident between the Haas driver and De Vries.
2023-06-18T18:53:45Z: Yellow flags cover the region as the two drivers return to the track. The pair had previously collided at Turn 1, allowing Russell to pass both.
2023-06-18T18:52:53Z: A yellow flag as Magnussen and De Vries tangle and slide off the track on the entrance to Turn 3.
2023-06-18T18:52:19Z: Gasly has been stopped the gain some clear air. Hard tyres go on again. As a result of those stopping, Russell is now up to P14. Could points really still be on the cards after his earlier crash?
2023-06-18T18:50:35Z: Uh oh! Norris is now officially under investigation for driving unnecessarily slowly behind the safety car.
2023-06-18T18:50:08Z: But Verstappen's pace is reflecting his comments, as on the last lap alone he pulled out 0.7s on Alonso.
2023-06-18T18:50:03Z: Hulkenberg's stop has triggered others in the midfield to do so. Zhou drops to P19.
2023-06-18T18:48:41Z: A second stop for Hulkenberg to free himself from the DRS train. He is now P19 but will have no issue in getting to the end of the race on this set of tyres.
2023-06-18T18:47:52Z: Verstappen complains about tyre life again but his lead has grown to 4.5s. Is this a bit of radio airways games or a genuine concern for Red Bull?
2023-06-18T18:46:26Z: Ferrari strategy, part III, as the team appears keen to pull Sainz into the pits but he overrules them looking to go longer.
2023-06-18T18:45:59Z: Albon takes Magnussen for P11 along the pit straight.
2023-06-18T18:44:15Z: From P16, Lance Stroll takes a second trip through the pits. A direct switch of hards for fresh hards. That moves Russell up one position from the foot of the order.
2023-06-18T18:42:38Z: The Ferrari strategy is a curious one (not for the first time). They need to go long and quick on the mediums to find a gap in the pack to pit and switch to the hards to attack late on.
2023-06-18T18:39:45Z: P10 and into the points for Piastri. With DRS on the main straight, Magnussen drops to P11.
2023-06-18T18:39:17Z: Alonso has already nipped out of DRS range of Hamilton to cement his second place. Verstappen, meanwhile, as grown his lead to 3.4s.
2023-06-18T18:38:53Z: But hold on, Norris has now been noted for driving unnecessarily slowly! Will he escape this one?
2023-06-18T18:38:26Z: As all that happens, Albon is monstered by Piastri through the final chicane. P11 for the McLaren driver.
2023-06-18T18:37:45Z: Great news for McLaren fans, as the stewards deem that no further action is required on Norris' potential unsafe release.
2023-06-18T18:37:34Z: The crumb of comfort for Hamilton is the stewards will take no further action on his pitlane incident with Alonso.
2023-06-18T18:36:59Z: Alonso, with DRS, makes his move on Hamilton to take second place! The Aston Martin driver goes up the inside of the Mercedes into the final chicane and makes the move stick, keeping the inside line on the main straight and into Turn 1.
2023-06-18T18:36:11Z: As a result of the drivers and teams sorting out their positions following the safety car restart, the stewards have declared no further investigation is required on the safety car infringements involving Bottas, Ocon and Magnussen.
2023-06-18T18:35:08Z: Knowing he has a potential penalty hanging over him, Norris is going for it. He moves up to P9 with a bold move on Magnussen.
2023-06-18T18:34:59Z: Verstappen, just as he was doing earlier before the safety car, is pulling a gap on Hamilton, as his advantage stretches to 2.1s at the end of lap 21.
2023-06-18T18:33:30Z: Piastri drops behind Albon to P12 after running across the runoff at the final chicane. He locked his right front and was never going to make that corner in a month of Sundays.
2023-06-18T18:32:50Z: Alonso sets a new fastest lap of 1m16.575s to close within half a second of Hamilton.
2023-06-18T18:31:28Z: The incident involving Norris is now officially under investigation.
2023-06-18T18:31:03Z: Verstappen is stretching the legs of his Red Bull as he blasts 1.5s ahead of Hamilton. The medium-shod Ferraris haven't made much of an impression on the front three on fresh hards.
2023-06-18T18:30:37Z: Piastri hints at a dive back on his team-mate but thinks better of it and slots in behind.
2023-06-18T18:30:04Z: The stewards have also noted a potential unsafe release for Norris, as the McLaren driver passes his team-mate for P10.
2023-06-18T18:29:48Z: The pitlane incident between Hamilton and Alonso is under investigation.
2023-06-18T18:28:56Z: Verstappen nails the restart to keep the lead from Hamilton, with Alonso unable to create an opening so keeps station.
2023-06-18T18:28:04Z: An incident of overtaking under the safety car involving Ocon, Bottas and Magnussen has been noted by the stewards.
2023-06-18T18:27:53Z: Verstappen vs Hamilton vs Alonso at the safety car restart. Hold on to your hats.
2023-06-18T18:26:41Z: The safety car - celebrating its 50th anniversary of use in F1 - is coming in at the end of this lap.
2023-06-18T18:26:16Z: The losers in this interruption as so far McLaren. Piastri is now P10 and Norris P11. Behind the leaders, Magnussen, Bottas, Ocon and Piastri complete the points positions.
2023-06-18T18:25:32Z: After all that, both Ferraris on mediums didn't pit so move up to fourth and fifth and neither did the trio who started on the hards - so Perez is sixth, Magnussen is seventh and Bottas is eighth.
2023-06-18T18:23:32Z: The safety car has fallen perfectly for Magnussen - the Haas driver stopping one lap before the intervention and climbing to P7. With Hulkenberg in P15, at least the team retains its top 10 representation.
2023-06-18T18:23:22Z: The Hamilton vs Alonso pitlane exit incident has been noted.
2023-06-18T18:22:34Z: Russell returns to the track in P19 with a new front wing and fresh tyres. It would be something of a miracle if he is able to continue!
2023-06-18T18:22:10Z: TV replays catch Russell's smack with the wall. He drifts over the kerb through Turn 8 which sends him sliding into the barrier on the exit of Turn 9. He makes it to the pits for fresh tyres, a new front wing and repairs.
2023-06-18T18:20:25Z: The safety car causes most drivers that had yet to stop to complete a trip through the pits. The exception? The Ferrari drivers, who climb to P4/5!
2023-06-18T18:20:02Z: That's triggered everyone into the pits, Verstappen has a clean stop, but on the exit Alonso and Hamilton almost collide.
2023-06-18T18:19:15Z: Russell has hit the wall! The safety car has been deployed!
2023-06-18T18:19:05Z: Norris progresses past Hulkenberg to move up to P7 as the Haas driver pulls into the pits. The German drops to P15.
2023-06-18T18:17:26Z: Gasly pits at the end of lap 10. He was the only driver to start on softs but returns to the track on hard Pirellis. He drops to P19.
2023-06-18T18:16:47Z: It is a three-way fight for second currently, as Russell has closed up behind Hamilton and Alonso. This could get tasty.
2023-06-18T18:15:13Z: Verstappen has stretched his lead to 3.2s straight after the virtual safety car period, while Hamilton is still keeping a close eye on a prowling Alonso.
2023-06-18T18:14:13Z: We go green again after that minor delay!
2023-06-18T18:13:52Z: The Williams was stranded on the exit of Turn 6. That is his first retirement of the season.
2023-06-18T18:13:46Z: Piastri cleared Hulkenberg just before the virtual safety car, and the Haas now has Norris, Leclerc and Albon for close company.
2023-06-18T18:13:09Z: The virtual safety car has been deployed to allow for the recovery of Sargeant's Williams.
2023-06-18T18:11:49Z: Alonso, with DRS, is sizing up Hamilton for a move on the long straights.
2023-06-18T18:11:38Z: At the rear of the field, Yuki Tsunoda is sitting pretty should there be a safety car. He stopped at the end of lap one to ditch his medium rubber and fit hards.
2023-06-18T18:10:58Z: In P17, De Vries has seen his most recent time deleted after the Dutchman took a trip through the runoff.
2023-06-18T18:10:24Z: At the end of lap five Verstappen leads by 1.8s from Hamilton, who has Alonso bearing down on him.
2023-06-18T18:09:11Z: Alonso takes a hit with his rear-right wheel at the exit of Turn 4. His Aston Martin is running OK but that won’t help his cause chasing Hamilton.
2023-06-18T18:08:43Z: It had been expected that Leclerc, Sainz and Perez would speed through the pack. So far, Leclerc is the only one of the trio to have made any progress.
2023-06-18T18:07:05Z: A good start for Piastri who is up to P7, and is currently lapping ahead of team-mate Norris. McLaren has not scored a point in Canada since Button and Magnussen both finished in the top nine in 2014.
2023-06-18T18:06:53Z: DRS is enabled but it won't be available to Hamilton for now as he's already one second off Verstappen.
2023-06-18T18:05:58Z: After banging wheels all the way around on Lap 1, Sainz has retaken P11 from Perez.
2023-06-18T18:05:51Z: Verstappen, as expected, has bolted at the front. At the end of the first lap he is 0.8s clear of Hamilton who is keeping an eye on Alonso behind him.
2023-06-18T18:05:25Z: Into the wall goes Magnussen at the final chicane. He manages to avoid serious danger and continues in P15.
2023-06-18T18:05:05Z: Ocon also got ahead of Hulkenberg at the start to take fifth. But all very clean and friendly through the first few corners.
2023-06-18T18:04:22Z: A good start for Leclerc who jumps Albon for P9 at the start. Perez also jumps Sainz.
2023-06-18T18:03:55Z: Verstappen keeps his lead but Hamilton bolts into second ahead of Alonso into the first corner!
2023-06-18T18:03:11Z: Zhou lines up, and we're ready to go!
2023-06-18T18:02:31Z: No issues for all 20 starters, as Verstappen lines up the pack on the starting grid. Here we go...
2023-06-18T18:00:19Z: The formation lap is under way - here we go!
2023-06-18T17:59:38Z: In short, 12th-14th hard, 15th soft, everywhere else it is the medium. Gasly starting on the softs is bold, given that tyre isn't predicted to last too many laps on heavy fuel.
2023-06-18T17:58:20Z: Tyres! Perez, Magnussen and Bottas start on the hards, Gasly starts on the softs and everyone else in on the mediums.
2023-06-18T17:55:02Z: What are your predictions for the race? Given how 2023 has gone so far it is hard to look past Verstappen enjoying another Sunday stroll, but you never know...
2023-06-18T17:51:40Z: With the pre-race grid ceremonies taken care of, the drivers are putting on their earpieces, balaclavas and helmets. Just under 10 minutes to go until lights out.
2023-06-18T17:48:27Z: It is time for the national anthem and Canada has gone for a sombre rendition of its favourite tune. That is, until Queen comes blasting over the PA system immediately after.
2023-06-18T17:42:48Z: Albon's car was also undergoing some minor work, with the engine cover off on the grid, but all is well for the Williams driver.
2023-06-18T17:40:32Z: It doesn't look too serious as Leclerc's car is lowered back down and things calm down between the Ferrari mechanics. And breathe.
2023-06-18T17:38:11Z: Leclerc hasn't had the best of luck recently and it appears it isn't getting any better, as on the grid his car is up on the jacks and the floor plank is being worked on.
2023-06-18T17:30:02Z: Due to the disrupted practice and qualifying running, there's a mix of tyre options available up and down the grid. Mercedes is a potential outlier that will be one to watch out for:https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/mercedes-a-potential-strategy-outlier-as-f1-tyre-sets-returned/10484688/
2023-06-18T17:24:49Z: After the rain deluge that spiced up Saturday, Montreal is dry and warm and is set to stay that way. So that means no switching between dry and wet tyres today, but there are a few interesting strategies set to be in play...
2023-06-18T17:19:52Z: This is no disrespect to Hulkenberg and Haas fans, but the upshot to his penalty is it puts Alonso on the front row alongside Verstappen, which always perks up interest for the start. Add Hamilton into the mix from third and this won't be one to miss.
2023-06-18T17:17:49Z: Hulkenberg isn't the only one, with Sainz, Stroll and Tsunoda each earning a three-place grid drop for impeding incidents during qualifying. As a result Sainz starts 11th, Stroll is 16th and Tsunoda is 19th.
2023-06-18T17:16:10Z: Some of you may have finished yesterday marvelling at Hulkenberg putting his Haas on the front row of the grid. But a red flag infringement in Q3 saw him slapped with a three-place grid penalty and so he is dropped to fifth.
2023-06-18T17:13:39Z: The F1 drivers are on their way to the grid and things look very different to yesterday for many reasons.
2023-06-18T17:12:12Z: Hello there! Who is ready for the Canadian GP eh?
